statement.title: # Content
statement.content: Giving a collection S of points on two dimension plane. ($S =$ {$(x\_0,y\_0), (x\_1,y\_1), \cdots $}) We define a point is greater than another point when all its coordinate on two axis are both greater than or equel to another one. Namely, $p$ is greater than $q$ when $x\_p \geq x\_q$ and $y\_p \geq y\_q$. A sequence is a list points < $p\_1, p\_2, \cdots $> satisfy that $i < j => p\_i$ is greater than $p\_j$. You can use the elements in $S$ to construct sequences, how many sequences needed to cover a $S$ at least?

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content: The input consists of several test cases. Each test case start with a line containing a number $n(0 < n \leq 1000000)$, the number of points in $S$. Then $n$ lines follows, each line containing two number, $x\_i, y\_i(0 \leq x\_i, y\_i < 100000)$, the position of point $i$. The input end with EOF.

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content: You have to print minium number of sequences needed to cover $S$ in a single line for each case.

statement.title: # Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
4 1 1 2 2 3 3 4 4 4 1 5 2 6 2 3 3 41 2
